intro: Hemsleya zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang hemslay, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slight sheen. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
